head.title: A Continuation of the Journal of the Forks Mackenzie's River for Summer 1807-1808. - Page #10

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #10 of 50 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Wentzel, Willard Ferdinand. A Continuation of the Journal of the Forks Mackenzie's River for Summer 1807-1808. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0022

div.p: Wednesy 1st[.] The weather extremely mild & Clear[.] [N]o Fish[.]

Thursy 2nd[.] Late in the Evening Arrived Mr Clarke in a light Canoe maned with 8 men & Colours flying in the Stern of his Canoe – from Athabasca[.] Gave each of his men a Dram – after we had a Short & Dry Kick up! [W]e recieved our Letters &c &c & every one went to bed – not however without gratifying ourselves with a perusal of our different Epistles & instructions[.]

Friday 3rd[.] Early in the morning the loaded Canoes or Mr C's Tail appeared to the number of 4 – laden with 21ps Each & manned with 5 Canadians[.] Gave these also a Dram agreeable to the heads request[.] After receiving their Several loadings we proceeded to Settle every thing as expeditiously as possible[.] Five men & 17ps Goods was laid aside for Mr Keiths Estabt[.] [F]our men & 11ps [Goods] was left at this Post – the remainder is to be divided between Bears Lake – & Blue Fish River &c[.] Mr Clarke requested that I Should dispatch letters to Lac D'ours in the begining of Decr to be at the last mentd Place about new years day[.] To display great feats in conjunction with the Canadians there – to the Amusement or for the entertainment of the new year[.] Fine weather[.]

Satury 4th[.] Early in the morning Messrs Clarke & Henry Sett off in Company for bears Lake – followed by two other loaded Canoes[.] About an hour after dispatched Smith with 6 Canadians for Mr Keith in two Canoes – two of these men I Send for a few Provns[.] After this I took an inventory of the Bales left here Per Mr Clarke – in which I found some trifling errors – except in the Firesteels which will be severely felt here for instead of 4 Dozen of Firesteels as Stated in the Act left here per Mr Clarke – only two Dozen is to be found[.] The mistake I suppose to have proceeded from the Steels being wrapped up per ½ dozens which were inadvertantly taken for dozens[.] Fine weather[.]
Suny 5th[.] Sett Martin & Gibeau arranging the Flooring in the Hall[.] [E]xceedingly mild weather[.]
Mony 6th[.] Made the men arrange the Chimneys[.]
Tuesy 7th[.] The Plastering of the inside & outside of the House terminated this days work[.] Arrived an Indian from Gros Cap[.] [B]rought 2 Brs & in meat Sent him to the Capot Rouge to Know

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
